title: PICTURED: Accused predator who allegedly filmed up the skirts of two teenage girls at Taronga Zoo
text:
A 48-year-old man accused of filming up the skirts of flight attendants and two teenagers at Taronga Zoo has been charged.

Justin McGufficke, who lives with his mum in Queensland, allegedly filmed the aircraft crew while on board a flight from the Gold Coast to Sydney.

Later in the day, he allegedly filmed two girls, aged 15 and 17, while following them through the zoo in Sydney.

Justin McGufficke, who lives with his mum in Queensland, allegedly filmed up the skirts of flight attendants while on board a flight from the Gold Coast to Sydney

McGufficke (pictured) is also accused filming two girls, aged 15 and 17, while following them through a zoo

He was taken to Chatswood police station, where 'upskirting' images were allegedly found on his mobile phone and digital camera.

McGufficke is facing numerous charges, including possessing child abuse material and filming private parts without consent.

He has also been charged with attempting to film private parts without consent and an aggravated attempt to film private parts with consent for a person under 16.

He was arrested at 1.30pm when another visitor notified zoo security, who contacted police.

McGufficke faced Manly Local Court on Wednesday, where he was bailed with strict conditions.

He must report to Tweed Heads Police Station daily and is banned from using any device which can take pictures such as a mobile phone.

He is banned from going to airports or Mosman.
